intro: Canarina moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan canarywood, is a small evergreen tree native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, fine-grained wood that is highly valued for its durability and workability. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by spherical fruits containing a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Canarina moluccana is considered a rare and endangered species.
